account_group_id.description: The ThousandEyes account group's unique ID.

api_endpoint.description: The ThousandEyes API Endpoint's URL. E.g. https://api.thousandeyes.com/v6

alerts_enabled.description: Set to 'true' to enable alerts, or 'false' to disable alerts. The default value is 'true'.

api_links.description: Self links to the endpoint to pull test metadata, and data links to the endpoint for test data. Read-only, and shows rel and href elements.

bgp_measurements.description: Enable BGP measurements. Set to true for enabled, false for disabled.

description.description: A description of the alert rule. Defaults to an empty string.

direction.description: [TO_TARGET, FROM_TARGET, BIDIRECTIONAL] The direction of the test (affects how results are shown).

dscp.description: The Differentiated Services Code Point (DSCP) label.

interval.description: The interval to run the test on, in seconds.

live_share.description: Set to 'true' for a test shared with your account group, or to 'false' for a normal test.

modified_date.description: The date the test was last modified. Shown in UTC.

mss.description: The maximum segment size, in bytes. Value can be from 30 to 1400.

mtu_measurements.description: Measure MTU sizes on the network from agents to the target.

network_measurements.description: Set to 'true' to enable network measurements.

path_trace_mode.description: [classic or inSession] Choose 'inSession' to perform the path trace within a TCP session. Default value is 'classic'.

protocol.description: [TCP or UDP] The protocol for agent to agent tests. Defaults to TCP.

saved_event.description: Set to 'true' for a saved event, or to 'false' for a normal test.

target_agent_id.description: The target agent's unique ID. Pulled from the /agents endpoint. Both the 'agents': [] and the targetAgentID cannot be Cloud Agents. Can be Enterprise Agent -> Cloud, Cloud -> Enterprise Agent, or Enterprise Agent -> Enterprise Agent.

test_id.description: The unique ID of the test.

throughput_duration.description: The throughput duration in milliseconds. The default value is 10000.

throughput_measurements.description: Enables or disables throughput measurements. This is not allowed when the source or target of the test is a Cloud Agent. Defaults to disabled.

throughput_rate.description: Defines the throughput rate. Fo UDP tests only.

use_public_bgp.description: Enable to automatically add all available Public BGP Monitors to the test.

agent_id.description: The unique ID for the ThousandEyes agent.

block.description: The list of ThousandEyes agents to use.

rule_id.description: The unique ID of the alert rule.

block.description: Gets the ruleId from the /alert-rules endpoint. If alertsEnabled is set to 'true' and alertRules is not included in a creation/update query, the applicable defaults will be used.

ip_address.description: The IP address of the BGP monitor.

monitor_id.description: The unique ID of the BGP monitor.

monitor_name.description: The name of the BGP monitor.

monitor_type.description: [Public or Private] Shows the type of BGP monitor.

network.description: The name of the autonomous system in which the BGP monitor is found.

block.description: The array of BGP monitor object IDs. The monitorIDs can be sourced from the /bgp-monitors endpoint.
[“serverName”: “fqdn of server”] The array of DNS Server objects.

This resource allows you to create and configure an agent-to-agent test. This test type evaluates the performance of the underlying network between two physical sites. For more information about agent-to-agent tests, see [Agent-to-Agent Tests](https://docs.thousandeyes.com/product-documentation/internet-and-wan-monitoring/tests#agent-to-agent-test).

alerts_enabled.description: Set to 'true' to enable alerts, or 'false' to disable alerts. The default value is 'true'.

api_links.description: Self links to the endpoint to pull test metadata, and data links to the endpoint for test data. Read-only, and shows rel and href elements.

bandwidth_measurements.description: Set to 1 to measure bandwidth. This only applies to Enterprise Agents assigned to the test, and requires that networkMeasurements is set. Defaults to 'false'.

bgp_measurements.description: Enable BGP measurements. Set to true for enabled, false for disabled.

description.description: A description of the alert rule. Defaults to an empty string.

interval.description: The interval to run the test on, in seconds.

live_share.description: Set to 'true' for a test shared with your account group, or to 'false' for a normal test.

modified_date.description: The date the test was last modified. Shown in UTC.

mtu_measurements.description: Measure MTU sizes on the network from agents to the target.

network_measurements.description: Set to 'true' to enable network measurements.

path_trace_mode.description: [classic or inSession] Choose 'inSession' to perform the path trace within a TCP session. Default value is 'classic'.

probe_mode.description: [AUTO, SACk, or SYN] The probe mode used by end-to-end network tests. This is only valid if the protocol is set to TCP. The default value is AUTO.

protocol.description: The protocol used by dependent network tests (end-to-end, path trace, PMTUD). Default value is TCP.

saved_event.description: Set to 'true' for a saved event, or to 'false' for a normal test.

test_id.description: The unique ID of the test.

use_public_bgp.description: Enable to automatically add all available Public BGP Monitors to the test.

agent_id.description: The unique ID for the ThousandEyes agent.

block.description: The list of ThousandEyes agents to use.

rule_id.description: The unique ID of the alert rule.

block.description: Gets the ruleId from the /alert-rules endpoint. If alertsEnabled is set to 'true' and alertRules is not included in a creation/update query, the applicable defaults will be used.

ip_address.description: The IP address of the BGP monitor.

monitor_id.description: The unique ID of the BGP monitor.

monitor_name.description: The name of the BGP monitor.

monitor_type.description: [Public or Private] Shows the type of BGP monitor.

network.description: The name of the autonomous system in which the BGP monitor is found.

block.description: The array of BGP monitor object IDs. The monitorIDs can be sourced from the /bgp-monitors endpoint.
[“serverName”: “fqdn of server”] The array of DNS Server objects.

This resource allows you to create and configure an agent-to-server test. This test type measures network performance as seen from ThousandEyes agent(s) towards a remote server. For more information about agent-to-server tests, see [Agent-to-Server Tests](https://docs.thousandeyes.com/product-documentation/internet-and-wan-monitoring/tests#agent-to-server-test).

alert_rule_id.description: The unique ID of the alert rule.

alert_type.description: [Page Load, HTTP Server, End-to-End (Server), End-to-End (Agent), DNS Server, DNS Trace, DNSSEC, Transactions, Web Transactions, BGP, Path Trace, FTP, SIP Server] The type of alert rule. Acceptable values include the verbose names of supported tests.

default.description: Alert rules allow up to 1 alert rule to be selected as a default for each type. By marking an alert rule as default, the rule will be automatically included in subsequently created tests that test a metric used in the alert rule.

direction.description: [TO_TARGET, FROM_TARGET, BIDIRECTIONAL] The direction of the test (affects how results are shown).

include_covered_prefixes.description: Include queries for subprefixes detected under this prefix.

minimum_sources.description: The minimum number of agents or monitors that must meet the specified criteria in order to trigger an alert. This option is mutually exclusive with 'minimum_sources_pct'.

minimum_sources_pct.description: The minimum percentage of agents or monitors that must meet the specified criteria in order to trigger an alert. This option is mutually exclusive with 'minimum_sources'.

notify_on_clear.description: Set to 'true' to trigger the notification when the alert clears.

rounds_violating_mode.description: [ANY or EXACT] Defines whether the same agent(s) must meet the EXACT same threshold in consecutive rounds or not. The default value is ANY.

rounds_violating_out_of.description: Specifies the divisor (Y value) of the “X of Y times” condition in an alert rule.  Minimum value is 1, maximum value is 10.

rounds_violating_required.description: Specifies the numerator (X value) of the “X of Y times” condition in an alert rule.  Minimum value is 1, maximum value is 10. Must be less than or equal to 'roundsViolatingOutOf'.

rule_id.description: The unique ID of the alert rule.

rule_name.description: The name of the alert rule.

severity.description: [INFO, MINOR, MAJOR or CRITICAL] The severity level of the alert rule. The default value is INFO.

message.description: The contents of the email, as a string.

recipient.description: The email addresses to send the notification to.

block.description: The email notification.

integration_id.description: The integration ID, as a string.

integration_type.description: The integration type, as a string.

block.description: Third party notification.

integration_id.description: The integration ID, as a string.

integration_type.description: The integration type, as a string.

block.description: Webhook notification.
The list of notifications for the alert rule.

test_id.description: The list of unique test IDs.

block.description: The list of included tests.

This resource allows you to create alert rules for ThousandEyes alerts. Alert rules define what alerts are sent, when, and to whom. For more information, see [Alert Rules](https://docs.thousandeyes.com/product-documentation/alerts#rule-configuration).

alerts_enabled.description: Set to 'true' to enable alerts, or 'false' to disable alerts. The default value is 'true'.

api_links.description: Self links to the endpoint to pull test metadata, and data links to the endpoint for test data. Read-only, and shows rel and href elements.

description.description: A description of the alert rule. Defaults to an empty string.

include_covered_prefixes.description: Include queries for subprefixes detected under this prefix.

live_share.description: Set to 'true' for a test shared with your account group, or to 'false' for a normal test.

modified_date.description: The date the test was last modified. Shown in UTC.

saved_event.description: Set to 'true' for a saved event, or to 'false' for a normal test.

test_id.description: The unique ID of the test.

use_public_bgp.description: Enable to automatically add all available Public BGP Monitors to the test.

rule_id.description: The unique ID of the alert rule.

block.description: Gets the ruleId from the /alert-rules endpoint. If alertsEnabled is set to 'true' and alertRules is not included in a creation/update query, the applicable defaults will be used.

ip_address.description: The IP address of the BGP monitor.

monitor_id.description: The unique ID of the BGP monitor.

monitor_name.description: The name of the BGP monitor.

monitor_type.description: [Public or Private] Shows the type of BGP monitor.

network.description: The name of the autonomous system in which the BGP monitor is found.

block.description: The array of BGP monitor object IDs. The monitorIDs can be sourced from the /bgp-monitors endpoint.
[“serverName”: “fqdn of server”] The array of DNS Server objects.

This resource allows you to create a ThousandEyes BGP test. This test type collects BGP routing related information and presents a visualization of the route and relevants events on the timeline. For more information, see [BGP Tests](https://docs.thousandeyes.com/product-documentation/internet-and-wan-monitoring/tests#bgp-test).

alerts_enabled.description: Set to 'true' to enable alerts, or 'false' to disable alerts. The default value is 'true'.

api_links.description: Self links to the endpoint to pull test metadata, and data links to the endpoint for test data. Read-only, and shows rel and href elements.

bandwidth_measurements.description: Set to 1 to measure bandwidth. This only applies to Enterprise Agents assigned to the test, and requires that networkMeasurements is set. Defaults to 'false'.

bgp_measurements.description: Enable BGP measurements. Set to true for enabled, false for disabled.

description.description: A description of the alert rule. Defaults to an empty string.

dns_transport_protocol.description: [UDP or TCP] The DNS transport protocol used for DNS requests. Defaults to UDP.

domain.description: See notes	target record for test, suffixed by record type (ie, www.thousandeyes.com CNAME). If no record type is specified, the test will default to an ANY record.

interval.description: The interval to run the test on, in seconds.

live_share.description: Set to 'true' for a test shared with your account group, or to 'false' for a normal test.

modified_date.description: The date the test was last modified. Shown in UTC.

mtu_measurements.description: Measure MTU sizes on the network from agents to the target.

network_measurements.description: Set to 'true' to enable network measurements.

path_trace_mode.description: [classic or inSession] Choose 'inSession' to perform the path trace within a TCP session. Default value is 'classic'.

probe_mode.description: [AUTO, SACk, or SYN] The probe mode used by end-to-end network tests. This is only valid if the protocol is set to TCP. The default value is AUTO.

protocol.description: The protocol used by dependent network tests (end-to-end, path trace, PMTUD). Default value is TCP.

recursive_queries.description: Defines whether to run the query with the recursion desired (RD) flag enabled.

saved_event.description: Set to 'true' for a saved event, or to 'false' for a normal test.

test_id.description: The unique ID of the test.

use_public_bgp.description: Enable to automatically add all available Public BGP Monitors to the test.

agent_id.description: The unique ID for the ThousandEyes agent.

block.description: The list of ThousandEyes agents to use.

rule_id.description: The unique ID of the alert rule.

block.description: Gets the ruleId from the /alert-rules endpoint. If alertsEnabled is set to 'true' and alertRules is not included in a creation/update query, the applicable defaults will be used.

ip_address.description: The IP address of the BGP monitor.

monitor_id.description: The unique ID of the BGP monitor.

monitor_name.description: The name of the BGP monitor.

monitor_type.description: [Public or Private] Shows the type of BGP monitor.

network.description: The name of the autonomous system in which the BGP monitor is found.

block.description: The array of BGP monitor object IDs. The monitorIDs can be sourced from the /bgp-monitors endpoint.

server_id.description: The unique ID of the DNS server.

block.description: The array of DNS Server objects (“serverName”: “fqdn of server”).
[“serverName”: “fqdn of server”] The array of DNS Server objects.

This resource allows users to create a DNS server test. This test type validates DNS records and provides service performance metrics. For more information, see [DNS Server Tests](https://docs.thousandeyes.com/product-documentation/internet-and-wan-monitoring/tests#dns-server-test).

alerts_enabled.description: Set to 'true' to enable alerts, or 'false' to disable alerts. The default value is 'true'.

api_links.description: Self links to the endpoint to pull test metadata, and data links to the endpoint for test data. Read-only, and shows rel and href elements.

description.description: A description of the alert rule. Defaults to an empty string.

dns_transport_protocol.description: [UDP or TCP] The DNS transport protocol used for DNS requests. Defaults to UDP.

domain.description: See notes	target record for test, suffixed by record type (ie, www.thousandeyes.com CNAME). If no record type is specified, the test will default to an ANY record.

interval.description: The interval to run the test on, in seconds.

live_share.description: Set to 'true' for a test shared with your account group, or to 'false' for a normal test.

modified_date.description: The date the test was last modified. Shown in UTC.

saved_event.description: Set to 'true' for a saved event, or to 'false' for a normal test.

test_id.description: The unique ID of the test.

agent_id.description: The unique ID for the ThousandEyes agent.

block.description: The list of ThousandEyes agents to use.

rule_id.description: The unique ID of the alert rule.

block.description: Gets the ruleId from the /alert-rules endpoint. If alertsEnabled is set to 'true' and alertRules is not included in a creation/update query, the applicable defaults will be used.
[“serverName”: “fqdn of server”] The array of DNS Server objects.

This resource provides users with the ability to create a DNS trace test. This test type verifies the delegation of DNS records and ensures the DNS hierarchy is as expected. For more information, see [DNS Trace Tests](https://docs.thousandeyes.com/product-documentation/internet-and-wan-monitoring/tests#dns-trace-test).

alerts_enabled.description: Set to 'true' to enable alerts, or 'false' to disable alerts. The default value is 'true'.

api_links.description: Self links to the endpoint to pull test metadata, and data links to the endpoint for test data. Read-only, and shows rel and href elements.

description.description: A description of the alert rule. Defaults to an empty string.

domain.description: See notes	target record for test, suffixed by record type (ie, www.thousandeyes.com CNAME). If no record type is specified, the test will default to an ANY record.

interval.description: The interval to run the test on, in seconds.

live_share.description: Set to 'true' for a test shared with your account group, or to 'false' for a normal test.

modified_date.description: The date the test was last modified. Shown in UTC.

saved_event.description: Set to 'true' for a saved event, or to 'false' for a normal test.

test_id.description: The unique ID of the test.

agent_id.description: The unique ID for the ThousandEyes agent.

block.description: The list of ThousandEyes agents to use.

rule_id.description: The unique ID of the alert rule.

block.description: Gets the ruleId from the /alert-rules endpoint. If alertsEnabled is set to 'true' and alertRules is not included in a creation/update query, the applicable defaults will be used.
[“serverName”: “fqdn of server”] The array of DNS Server objects.

This resource allows you to create a DNSSEC test. This test type verifies the digital signature of DNS resource records and validates the authenticity of those records. For more information, see [DNSSEC Test](https://docs.thousandeyes.com/product-documentation/internet-and-wan-monitoring/tests#dnssec-test).

alerts_enabled.description: Set to 'true' to enable alerts, or 'false' to disable alerts. The default value is 'true'.

api_links.description: Self links to the endpoint to pull test metadata, and data links to the endpoint for test data. Read-only, and shows rel and href elements.

bgp_measurements.description: Enable BGP measurements. Set to true for enabled, false for disabled.

description.description: A description of the alert rule. Defaults to an empty string.

download_limit.description: Specify the maximum number of bytes to download from the target object.

ftp_target_time.description: The target time for operation completion. Specified in milliseconds.

ftp_time_limit.description: Set the time limit for the test (in seconds). FTP tests default to 10s.

interval.description: The interval to run the test on, in seconds.

live_share.description: Set to 'true' for a test shared with your account group, or to 'false' for a normal test.

modified_date.description: The date the test was last modified. Shown in UTC.

mtu_measurements.description: Measure MTU sizes on the network from agents to the target.

network_measurements.description: Set to 'true' to enable network measurements.

password.description: The password to be used to authenticate with the destination server (required for FTP).

path_trace_mode.description: [classic or inSession] Choose 'inSession' to perform the path trace within a TCP session. Default value is 'classic'.

probe_mode.description: [AUTO, SACk, or SYN] The probe mode used by end-to-end network tests. This is only valid if the protocol is set to TCP. The default value is AUTO.

protocol.description: The protocol used by dependent network tests (end-to-end, path trace, PMTUD). Default value is TCP.

request_type.description: [Download, Upload, or List] Sets the type of activity for the test.

saved_event.description: Set to 'true' for a saved event, or to 'false' for a normal test.

test_id.description: The unique ID of the test.

url.description: The target URL for the test.

use_active_ftp.description: Enables active FTP. If not set, tests default to use passive FTP.

use_explicit_ftps.description: Enables explicit FTPS (FTP over SSL). By default, tests will autodetect when it is appropriate to use FTPS.

username.description: The username to be used to authenticate with the destination server.

agent_id.description: The unique ID for the ThousandEyes agent.

block.description: The list of ThousandEyes agents to use.

rule_id.description: The unique ID of the alert rule.

block.description: Gets the ruleId from the /alert-rules endpoint. If alertsEnabled is set to 'true' and alertRules is not included in a creation/update query, the applicable defaults will be used.
[“serverName”: “fqdn of server”] The array of DNS Server objects.

This resource allows you to create an FTP server test. This test type verifies the availability and performance of FTP servers. For more information, see [FTP Server Tests](https://docs.thousandeyes.com/product-documentation/internet-and-wan-monitoring/tests#ftp-server-test).

alerts_enabled.description: Set to 'true' to enable alerts, or 'false' to disable alerts. The default value is 'true'.

api_links.description: Self links to the endpoint to pull test metadata, and data links to the endpoint for test data. Read-only, and shows rel and href elements.

auth_type.description: [NONE, BASIC, NTLM, KERBEROS] The HTTP authentication type. Defaults to NONE.

bandwidth_measurements.description: Set to 1 to measure bandwidth. This only applies to Enterprise Agents assigned to the test, and requires that networkMeasurements is set. Defaults to 'false'.

bgp_measurements.description: Enable BGP measurements. Set to true for enabled, false for disabled.

client_certificate.description: String representation (containing newline characters) of the client certificate, if used.

content_regex.description: Verify content using a regular expression. This field does not require escaping.

description.description: A description of the alert rule. Defaults to an empty string.

desired_status_code.description: The valid HTTP response code you’re interested in retrieving.

dns_override.description: The IP address to use for DNS override.

download_limit.description: Specify the maximum number of bytes to download from the target object.

follow_redirects.description: Follow HTTP/301 or HTTP/302 redirect directives. Defaults to 'true'.

headers.description: ["header: value", "header2: value"] The array of header strings.

http_target_time.description: The target time for HTTP server completion, specified in milliseconds.

http_time_limit.description: The target time for HTTP server limits, specified in seconds.

http_version.description: Set to 2 for the default HTTP version (prefer HTTP/2), or 1 for HTTP/1.1 only.

interval.description: The interval to run the test on, in seconds.

live_share.description: Set to 'true' for a test shared with your account group, or to 'false' for a normal test.

modified_date.description: The date the test was last modified. Shown in UTC.

mtu_measurements.description: Measure MTU sizes on the network from agents to the target.

network_measurements.description: Set to 'true' to enable network measurements.

password.description: The password to be used to authenticate with the destination server.

path_trace_mode.description: [classic or inSession] Choose 'inSession' to perform the path trace within a TCP session. Default value is 'classic'.

post_body.description: The POST body content. No escaping is required. If the post body is set to something other than empty, the requestMethod will be set to POST.

probe_mode.description: [AUTO, SACk, or SYN] The probe mode used by end-to-end network tests. This is only valid if the protocol is set to TCP. The default value is AUTO.

protocol.description: The protocol used by dependent network tests (end-to-end, path trace, PMTUD). Default value is TCP.

saved_event.description: Set to 'true' for a saved event, or to 'false' for a normal test.

ssl_version.description: Reflects the verbose ssl protocol version used by a test.

ssl_version_id.description: Defines the SSL version. 0 for auto, 3 for SSLv3, 4 for TLS v1.0, 5 for TLS v1.1, 6 for TLS v1.2.

test_id.description: The unique ID of the test.

url.description: The target URL for the test.

use_ntlm.description: Enable to use basic authentication. Only include this field if you are using authentication. Requires the username and password to be set if enabled.

user_agent.description: The user-agent string to be provided during the test.

username.description: The username to be used to authenticate with the destination server.

verify_certificate.description: Set whether to ignore certificate errors. Set to 'false' to ignore certificate errors. The default value is 'true'.

agent_id.description: The unique ID for the ThousandEyes agent.

block.description: The list of ThousandEyes agents to use.

rule_id.description: The unique ID of the alert rule.

block.description: Gets the ruleId from the /alert-rules endpoint. If alertsEnabled is set to 'true' and alertRules is not included in a creation/update query, the applicable defaults will be used.

ip_address.description: The IP address of the BGP monitor.

monitor_id.description: The unique ID of the BGP monitor.

monitor_name.description: The name of the BGP monitor.

monitor_type.description: [Public or Private] Shows the type of BGP monitor.

network.description: The name of the autonomous system in which the BGP monitor is found.

block.description: The array of BGP monitor object IDs. The monitorIDs can be sourced from the /bgp-monitors endpoint.
[“serverName”: “fqdn of server”] The array of DNS Server objects.

This resource allows you to create an HTTP server test. This test type measures the availability and performance of an HTTP service. For more information, see [HTTP Server Tests](https://docs.thousandeyes.com/product-documentation/internet-and-wan-monitoring/tests#http-server-test).

builtin.description: Set to 'true' for built-in labels, or to 'false' for user-created labels. Built-in labels are read-only.

group_id.description: The unique ID of the label. For built-in labels, this number is a negative.

type.description: [tests, agents, endpoint_tests, or endpoint_agents] The type of label.

agent_id.description: The list of unique agent IDs that the label is applied to.

block.description: The list of agents to use.

test_id.description: The list of unique test IDs.

block.description: The list of included tests.

This resource allows you to create labels for ThousandEyes agents and test groups. Labels are used to quickly select an agent group or a test group, and apply them to a specific context (for example, applying a group of tests to an agent). For more information, see [Working with Labels](https://docs.thousandeyes.com/product-documentation/internet-and-wan-monitoring/tests/working-with-labels-for-agent-and-test-groups).

alerts_enabled.description: Set to 'true' to enable alerts, or 'false' to disable alerts. The default value is 'true'.

api_links.description: Self links to the endpoint to pull test metadata, and data links to the endpoint for test data. Read-only, and shows rel and href elements.

auth_type.description: [NONE, BASIC, NTLM, KERBEROS] The HTTP authentication type. Defaults to NONE.

bandwidth_measurements.description: Set to 1 to measure bandwidth. This only applies to Enterprise Agents assigned to the test, and requires that networkMeasurements is set. Defaults to 'false'.

bgp_measurements.description: Enable BGP measurements. Set to true for enabled, false for disabled.

content_regex.description: Verify content using a regular expression. This field does not require escaping.

description.description: A description of the alert rule. Defaults to an empty string.

follow_redirects.description: Follow HTTP/301 or HTTP/302 redirect directives. Defaults to 'true'.

http_interval.description: The interval to run the HTTP server test on.

http_target_time.description: The target time for HTTP server completion, specified in milliseconds.

http_time_limit.description: The target time for HTTP server limits, specified in seconds.

http_version.description: Set to 2 for the default HTTP version (prefer HTTP/2), or 1 for HTTP/1.1 only.

include_headers.description: Set to 'true' to capture response headers for objects loaded by the test.

interval.description: The interval to run the test on, in seconds.

live_share.description: Set to 'true' for a test shared with your account group, or to 'false' for a normal test.

modified_date.description: The date the test was last modified. Shown in UTC.

mtu_measurements.description: Measure MTU sizes on the network from agents to the target.

network_measurements.description: Set to 'true' to enable network measurements.

page_load_target_time.description: The target time for page load completion, specified in seconds (1 to 30). The value cannot exceed the pageLoadTimeLimit value.

page_load_time_limit.description: The page load time limit. This value must be larger than httpTimeLimit, and defaults to 10 seconds.

password.description: The password to be used to authenticate with the destination server.

path_trace_mode.description: [classic or inSession] Choose 'inSession' to perform the path trace within a TCP session. Default value is 'classic'.

probe_mode.description: [AUTO, SACk, or SYN] The probe mode used by end-to-end network tests. This is only valid if the protocol is set to TCP. The default value is AUTO.

protocol.description: The protocol used by dependent network tests (end-to-end, path trace, PMTUD). Default value is TCP.

saved_event.description: Set to 'true' for a saved event, or to 'false' for a normal test.

ssl_version.description: Reflects the verbose ssl protocol version used by a test.

ssl_version_id.description: Defines the SSL version. 0 for auto, 3 for SSLv3, 4 for TLS v1.0, 5 for TLS v1.1, 6 for TLS v1.2.

subinterval.description: The subinterval for round-robin testing (in seconds). The value must be less than or equal to 'interval'.

test_id.description: The unique ID of the test.

url.description: The target URL for the test.

use_ntlm.description: Enable to use basic authentication. Only include this field if you are using authentication. Requires the username and password to be set if enabled.

use_public_bgp.description: Enable to automatically add all available Public BGP Monitors to the test.

user_agent.description: The user-agent string to be provided during the test.

username.description: The username to be used to authenticate with the destination server.

verify_certificate.description: Set whether to ignore certificate errors. Set to 'false' to ignore certificate errors. The default value is 'true'.

agent_id.description: The unique ID for the ThousandEyes agent.

block.description: The list of ThousandEyes agents to use.

rule_id.description: The unique ID of the alert rule.

block.description: Gets the ruleId from the /alert-rules endpoint. If alertsEnabled is set to 'true' and alertRules is not included in a creation/update query, the applicable defaults will be used.

ip_address.description: The IP address of the BGP monitor.

monitor_id.description: The unique ID of the BGP monitor.

monitor_name.description: The name of the BGP monitor.

monitor_type.description: [Public or Private] Shows the type of BGP monitor.

network.description: The name of the autonomous system in which the BGP monitor is found.

block.description: The array of BGP monitor object IDs. The monitorIDs can be sourced from the /bgp-monitors endpoint.
[“serverName”: “fqdn of server”] The array of DNS Server objects.

This resource allows you to create a page load test. This test type obtains in-browser site performance metrics. For more information, see [Page Load Tests](https://docs.thousandeyes.com/product-documentation/internet-and-wan-monitoring/tests#page-load-test).

alerts_enabled.description: Set to 'true' to enable alerts, or 'false' to disable alerts. The default value is 'true'.

api_links.description: Self links to the endpoint to pull test metadata, and data links to the endpoint for test data. Read-only, and shows rel and href elements.

bandwidth_measurements.description: Set to 1 to measure bandwidth. This only applies to Enterprise Agents assigned to the test, and requires that networkMeasurements is set. Defaults to 'false'.

bgp_measurements.description: Enable BGP measurements. Set to true for enabled, false for disabled.

description.description: A description of the alert rule. Defaults to an empty string.

interval.description: The interval to run the test on, in seconds.

live_share.description: Set to 'true' for a test shared with your account group, or to 'false' for a normal test.

modified_date.description: The date the test was last modified. Shown in UTC.

mtu_measurements.description: Measure MTU sizes on the network from agents to the target.

network_measurements.description: Set to 'true' to enable network measurements.

options_regex.description: A regex string of options. This field does not require escaping.

path_trace_mode.description: [classic or inSession] Choose 'inSession' to perform the path trace within a TCP session. Default value is 'classic'.

probe_mode.description: [AUTO, SACk, or SYN] The probe mode used by end-to-end network tests. This is only valid if the protocol is set to TCP. The default value is AUTO.

register_enabled.description: Configure whether to perform SIP registration on the test target with the SIP REGISTER command. Default value is 'false'.

saved_event.description: Set to 'true' for a saved event, or to 'false' for a normal test.

sip_target_time.description: The target time for test completion, specified in milliseconds.

sip_time_limit.description: The test time limit. Can be between 5 and 10 seconds, and defaults to 5 seconds.

test_id.description: The unique ID of the test.

use_public_bgp.description: Enable to automatically add all available Public BGP Monitors to the test.

agent_id.description: The unique ID for the ThousandEyes agent.

block.description: The list of ThousandEyes agents to use.

rule_id.description: The unique ID of the alert rule.

block.description: Gets the ruleId from the /alert-rules endpoint. If alertsEnabled is set to 'true' and alertRules is not included in a creation/update query, the applicable defaults will be used.
[“serverName”: “fqdn of server”] The array of DNS Server objects.

auth_user.description: The username for authentication with the SIP server.

password.description: The password to be used to authenticate with the destination server.

protocol.description: [TCP, TLS, or UDP] The transport layer for SIP communication. Can be either TCP, TLS (TLS over TCP), or UDP, and defaults to TCP.

sip_proxy.description: The SIP proxy. This is distinct from the SIP server, and is specified as a domain name or IP address.

sip_registrar.description: The SIP server to be tested, specified by domain name or IP address.

user.description: The username for SIP registration. This should be unique within a ThousandEyes account group.

block.description: The Target SIP server credentials.

This resource allows you to create a SIP server test. This test type checks for the availability and performance of a VoIP SIP server, confirms the ability to perform SIP Register with a target server, and observes the requests and responses. For more information, see [SIP Server Tests](https://docs.thousandeyes.com/product-documentation/internet-and-wan-monitoring/tests#sip-server-test).

alerts_enabled.description: Set to 'true' to enable alerts, or 'false' to disable alerts. The default value is 'true'.

api_links.description: Self links to the endpoint to pull test metadata, and data links to the endpoint for test data. Read-only, and shows rel and href elements.

bgp_measurements.description: Enable BGP measurements. Set to true for enabled, false for disabled.

codec_id.description: The unique ID of the codec to use.

description.description: A description of the alert rule. Defaults to an empty string.

dscp.description: The Differentiated Services Code Point (DSCP) label.

duration.description: The duration of the test, in seconds (5 to 30).

interval.description: The interval to run the test on, in seconds.

jitter_buffer.description: The de-jitter buffer size, in seconds (0 to 150).

live_share.description: Set to 'true' for a test shared with your account group, or to 'false' for a normal test.

modified_date.description: The date the test was last modified. Shown in UTC.

mtu_measurements.description: Measure MTU sizes on the network from agents to the target.

saved_event.description: Set to 'true' for a saved event, or to 'false' for a normal test.

target_agent_id.description: The target agent's unique ID. Pulled from the /agents endpoint. Both the 'agents': [] and the targetAgentID cannot be Cloud Agents. Can be Enterprise Agent -> Cloud, Cloud -> Enterprise Agent, or Enterprise Agent -> Enterprise Agent.

test_id.description: The unique ID of the test.

use_public_bgp.description: Enable to automatically add all available Public BGP Monitors to the test.

agent_id.description: The unique ID for the ThousandEyes agent.

block.description: The list of ThousandEyes agents to use.

rule_id.description: The unique ID of the alert rule.

block.description: Gets the ruleId from the /alert-rules endpoint. If alertsEnabled is set to 'true' and alertRules is not included in a creation/update query, the applicable defaults will be used.

ip_address.description: The IP address of the BGP monitor.

monitor_id.description: The unique ID of the BGP monitor.

monitor_name.description: The name of the BGP monitor.

monitor_type.description: [Public or Private] Shows the type of BGP monitor.

network.description: The name of the autonomous system in which the BGP monitor is found.

block.description: The array of BGP monitor object IDs. The monitorIDs can be sourced from the /bgp-monitors endpoint.
[“serverName”: “fqdn of server”] The array of DNS Server objects.

This resource allows you to create a RTP Stream test. This test type measures the quality of real-time protocol (RTP) voice streams between ThousandEyes agents that act as VoIP user agents. For more information, see [RTP Stream Tests](https://docs.thousandeyes.com/product-documentation/internet-and-wan-monitoring/tests#rtp-stream-test).

alerts_enabled.description: Set to 'true' to enable alerts, or 'false' to disable alerts. The default value is 'true'.

api_links.description: Self links to the endpoint to pull test metadata, and data links to the endpoint for test data. Read-only, and shows rel and href elements.

auth_type.description: [NONE, BASIC, NTLM, KERBEROS] The HTTP authentication type. Defaults to NONE.

bandwidth_measurements.description: Set to 1 to measure bandwidth. This only applies to Enterprise Agents assigned to the test, and requires that networkMeasurements is set. Defaults to 'false'.

content_regex.description: Verify content using a regular expression. This field does not require escaping.

credentials.description: The array of credentialID integers. You can get the credentialId from the /credentials endpoint.

description.description: A description of the alert rule. Defaults to an empty string.

desired_status_code.description: The valid HTTP response code you’re interested in retrieving.

http_target_time.description: The target time for HTTP server completion, specified in milliseconds.

http_time_limit.description: The target time for HTTP server limits, specified in seconds.

http_version.description: Set to 2 for the default HTTP version (prefer HTTP/2), or 1 for HTTP/1.1 only.

include_headers.description: Set to 'true' to capture response headers for objects loaded by the test.

interval.description: The interval to run the test on, in seconds.

live_share.description: Set to 'true' for a test shared with your account group, or to 'false' for a normal test.

modified_date.description: The date the test was last modified. Shown in UTC.

mtu_measurements.description: Measure MTU sizes on the network from agents to the target.

network_measurements.description: Set to 'true' to enable network measurements.

password.description: The password to be used to authenticate with the destination server.

path_trace_mode.description: [classic or inSession] Choose 'inSession' to perform the path trace within a TCP session. Default value is 'classic'.

probe_mode.description: [AUTO, SACk, or SYN] The probe mode used by end-to-end network tests. This is only valid if the protocol is set to TCP. The default value is AUTO.

protocol.description: The protocol used by dependent network tests (end-to-end, path trace, PMTUD). Default value is TCP.

saved_event.description: Set to 'true' for a saved event, or to 'false' for a normal test.

ssl_version_id.description: Defines the SSL version. 0 for auto, 3 for SSLv3, 4 for TLS v1.0, 5 for TLS v1.1, 6 for TLS v1.2.

subinterval.description: The subinterval for round-robin testing (in seconds). The value must be less than or equal to 'interval'.

target_time.description: The target time for completion. The default value is 50 percent of the time limit, specified in seconds.

test_id.description: The unique ID of the test.

time_limit.description: The time limit for the transaction. The default value is 30s.

url.description: The target URL for the test.

use_ntlm.description: Enable to use basic authentication. Only include this field if you are using authentication. Requires the username and password to be set if enabled.

user_agent.description: The user-agent string to be provided during the test.

username.description: The username to be used to authenticate with the destination server.

verify_certificate.description: Set whether to ignore certificate errors. Set to 'false' to ignore certificate errors. The default value is 'true'.

agent_id.description: The unique ID for the ThousandEyes agent.

block.description: The list of ThousandEyes agents to use.

rule_id.description: The unique ID of the alert rule.

block.description: Gets the ruleId from the /alert-rules endpoint. If alertsEnabled is set to 'true' and alertRules is not included in a creation/update query, the applicable defaults will be used.
[“serverName”: “fqdn of server”] The array of DNS Server objects.

This resource allows users to create a transaction test. This test type is a scripted synthetic browser interaction that can traverse multiple pages and user actions. For more information, see [Transaction Tests](https://docs.thousandeyes.com/product-documentation/browser-synthetics/transaction-tests).

aid.description: The unique ID for the account group.

name.description: The name of the account group.

block.description: This data source allows you to configure a ThousandEyes account group. For more information, see [What is an Account Group](https://docs.thousandeyes.com/product-documentation/user-management/account-groups/what-is-an-account-group).

agent_id.description: The unique ID of the agent.

ip_addresses.description: The array of IP Addresses entries for the agent.

block.description: This data source allows you to define a ThousandEyes agent. For more information, see [Global Vantage Points](https://docs.thousandeyes.com/product-documentation/global-vantage-points).

ip_address.description: The IP address of the BGP monitor.

monitor_id.description: The unique ID of BGP monitor.

monitor_name.description: The display name of the BGP monitor.

monitor_type.description: The type of BGP monitor (either Public or Private).

network.description: The name of the autonomous system in which the monitor is found.

block.description: This data source allows you to configure private and public BGP monitors. For more information, see [BGP Tests](https://docs.thousandeyes.com/product-documentation/internet-and-wan-monitoring/tests/bgp-tests).

auth_method.description: (PagerDuty only) The authentication method. Always set to `Auth Token`.

integration_id.description: The unique ID of the integration.

target.description: The target URL of the integration.

block.description: This data source allows you to configure a third-party integration for ThousandEyes alerts. Supported integrations include PagerDuty, Slack, AppDynamics, and ServiceNow. For more information, see [Alerts Integrations](https://docs.thousandeyes.com/product-documentation/alerts/integrations).
